item.text: When Rachel saw that she could not give Jacob children, she became jealous of her sister. She said to Jacob, “Give me children or I’ll die!”

<st data-num="0639 03290">Jacob</st> <st data-num="02734" class="">became furious</st><n id="1" /> with <st data-num="07354" class="">Rachel</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">exclaimed</st>, “Am <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">in the place of</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> has <st data-num="04513" class="">kept</st> you <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> <st data-num="06529 0990">having children</st>?”<n id="2" />
She replied, “Here is my servant Bilhah! Sleep with her so that she can bear children for me and I can have a family through her.”
So Rachel gave him her servant Bilhah as a wife, and Jacob slept with her.

<st data-num="01090" class="">Bilhah</st> <st data-num="02029" class="">became pregnant</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03205" class="">gave</st> <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> a <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.<n id="2" />
Then Rachel said, “God has vindicated me. He has responded to my prayer and given me a son.” That is why she named him Dan.
Bilhah, Rachel’s servant, became pregnant again and gave Jacob another son.
Then Rachel said, “I have fought a desperate struggle with my sister, but I have won.” So she named him Naphtali.
When Leah saw that she had stopped having children, she gave her servant Zilpah to Jacob as a wife.

Soon <st data-num="03812" class="">Leah’s</st> <st data-num="08198" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="02153" class="">Zilpah</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">gave</st> <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> a <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.<n id="1" />
Leah said, “How fortunate!” So she named him Gad.
Then Leah’s servant Zilpah gave Jacob another son.
Leah said, “How happy I am, for women will call me happy!” So she named him Asher.
At the time of the wheat harvest Reuben went out and found some mandrake plants in a field and brought them to his mother Leah. Rachel said to Leah, “Give me some of your son’s mandrakes.”

But Leah <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>,<n id="1" /> “Wasn’t it <st data-num="04592" class="">enough</st> that you’ve <st data-num="03947" class="">taken away</st> my <st data-num="0582" class="">husband</st>? Would you <st data-num="03947" class="">take away</st> my <st data-num="01121" class="">son’s</st> <st data-num="01736" class="">mandrakes</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">too</st>?” “<st data-num="03651" class="">All right</st>,”<n id="2" /> <st data-num="07354" class="">Rachel</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “he may <st data-num="07901" class="">go to bed</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st><n id="3" /> you <st data-num="03915" class="">tonight</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">in exchange for</st> your <st data-num="01121" class="">son’s</st> <st data-num="01736" class="">mandrakes</st>.”

When <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came in</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="07704" class="">fields</st> that <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>, <st data-num="03812" class="">Leah</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">went out</st> to <st data-num="07125" class="">meet</st> him and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “You must <st data-num="0935" class="">sleep</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">with</st> me <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> I have <st data-num="07936" class="">paid for</st> your <st data-num="07936" class="">services</st><n id="2" /> with my <st data-num="01121" class="">son’s</st> <st data-num="01736" class="">mandrakes</st>.” So <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> <st data-num="07901" class="">went to bed</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st><n id="3" /> her that <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st>.

<st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">paid attention</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03812" class="">Leah</st>; she <st data-num="02029" class="">became pregnant</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03205" class="">gave</st> <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> a <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> for the <st data-num="02549" class="">fifth</st> time.<n id="3" />
Then Leah said, “God has granted me a reward because I gave my servant to my husband as a wife.” So she named him Issachar.
Leah became pregnant again and gave Jacob a son for the sixth time.
Then Leah said, “God has given me a good gift. Now my husband will honor me because I have given him six sons.” So she named him Zebulun.
After that she gave birth to a daughter and named her Dinah.
Then God took note of Rachel. He paid attention to her and enabled her to become pregnant.

She <st data-num="02029" class="">became pregnant</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03205" class="">gave birth to</st> a <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>. Then she <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> has <st data-num="0622" class="">taken away</st> my <st data-num="02781" class="">shame</st>.”<n id="2" />
She named him Joseph, saying, “May the Lord give me yet another son.”
After Rachel had given birth to Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, “Send me on my way so that I can go home to my own country.
Let me take my wives and my children whom I have acquired by working for you. Then I’ll depart, because you know how hard I’ve worked for you.”
But Laban said to him, “If I have found favor in your sight, please stay here, for I have learned by divination that the Lord has blessed me on account of you.”
He added, “Just name your wages—I’ll pay whatever you want.”
“You know how I have worked for you,” Jacob replied, “and how well your livestock have fared under my care.

Indeed, you had little before I arrived, but now your possessions have increased many times over. The Lord has blessed you wherever I worked. But now, how long must it be before I do something for my own family too?”
So Laban asked, “What should I give you?” “You don’t need to give me a thing,” Jacob replied, “but if you agree to this one condition, I will continue to care for your flocks and protect them:

Let me <st data-num="05674" class="">walk</st> among<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> your <st data-num="06629" class="">flocks</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">today</st> and <st data-num="05493" class="">remove</st> from <st data-num="08033" class="">them</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="05348" class="">speckled</st> or <st data-num="02921" class="">spotted</st> <st data-num="07716" class="">sheep</st>, <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="02345" class="">dark-colored</st> <st data-num="07716 03775">lamb</st>,<n id="2" /> and the <st data-num="02921" class="">spotted</st> or <st data-num="05348" class="">speckled</st> <st data-num="05795" class="">goats</st>.<n id="3" /> These animals will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> my <st data-num="07939" class="">wages</st>.<n id="4" />

My <st data-num="06666" class="">integrity</st> will <st data-num="06030" class="">testify</st> for me<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03117 04279">later on</st>.<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">When</st> you <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> to <st data-num="05921" class="">verify</st> that I’ve taken only the <st data-num="07939" class="">wages</st> we <st data-num="06440" class="">agreed on</st>,<n id="3" /> if I have in my possession <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> <st data-num="05795" class="">goat</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0369" class="">is not</st> <st data-num="05348" class="">speckled</st> or <st data-num="02921" class="">spotted</st> or any <st data-num="03775" class="">sheep</st> that is not <st data-num="02345" class="">dark-colored</st>, <st data-num="01931" class="">it</st> will be considered <st data-num="01589 0854">stolen</st>.”<n id="4" />
“Agreed!” said Laban, “It will be as you say.”

So that day Laban removed the male goats that were streaked or spotted, all the female goats that were speckled or spotted (all that had any white on them), and all the dark-colored lambs, and put them in the care of his sons.
Then he separated them from Jacob by a three-day journey, while Jacob was taking care of the rest of Laban’s flocks.
But Jacob took fresh-cut branches from poplar, almond, and plane trees. He made white streaks by peeling them, making the white inner wood in the branches visible.

Then he <st data-num="03322" class="">set up</st> the <st data-num="0834 06478">peeled</st> <st data-num="04731" class="">branches</st> in all the <st data-num="08268 04325">watering</st> <st data-num="07298" class="">troughs</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">where</st> the <st data-num="06629" class="">flocks</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> to <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st>. He set up the branches <st data-num="05227" class="">in front of</st> the <st data-num="06629" class="">flocks</st> when they <st data-num="03179" class="">were in heat</st> and <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> to <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st>.<n id="1" />

When the <st data-num="06629" class="">sheep</st> <st data-num="03179" class="">mated</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">in front of</st> the <st data-num="04731" class="">branches</st>, <st data-num="06629" class="">they</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03205">gave birth to</st> young that were <st data-num="06124" class="">streaked</st> or <st data-num="05348" class="">speckled</st> or <st data-num="02921" class="">spotted</st>.

<st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> <st data-num="06504" class="">removed</st> these <st data-num="03775" class="">lambs</st>, but he <st data-num="05414" class="">made</st> the rest of the <st data-num="06629" class="">flock</st> <st data-num="06440 0413">face</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="06124" class="">streaked</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">completely</st> <st data-num="02345" class="">dark-colored</st> animals in <st data-num="03837" class="">Laban’s</st> <st data-num="06629" class="">flock</st>. So he <st data-num="07896" class="">made</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">separate</st> <st data-num="05739" class="">flocks</st> for himself and did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07896" class="">mix</st> them <st data-num="05921" class="">with</st> <st data-num="03837" class="">Laban’s</st> <st data-num="06629" class="">flocks</st>.

<st data-num="01961 03605">When</st> the <st data-num="06629 07194">stronger females</st> <st data-num="03179" class="">were in heat</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> would <st data-num="07760" class="">set up</st> the <st data-num="04731" class="">branches</st> in the <st data-num="07298" class="">troughs</st> in <st data-num="05869" class="">front</st> of the <st data-num="06629" class="">flock</st>, so they would <st data-num="03179" class="">mate</st> near the <st data-num="04731" class="">branches</st>.

But if the <st data-num="06629" class="">animals</st> <st data-num="05848" class="">were weaker</st>, he did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07760" class="">set</st> the branches there.<n id="1" /> So the <st data-num="05848" class="">weaker</st> animals <st data-num="01961" class="">ended up</st> belonging to <st data-num="03837" class="">Laban</st><n id="2" /> and the <st data-num="07194" class="">stronger</st> animals to <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st>.
In this way Jacob became extremely prosperous. He owned large flocks, male and female servants, camels, and donkeys.
